result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Helen J Bender

defendant.name: Bender, Helen J

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Helen J Bender in court.  Attorney Marcellus N Parker in court for Helen J Bender.  Attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim present in court. Case is calendared for a deferred prosecution agreement hearing. State will not be moving forward with the DPA resolution and has relayed a new offer to Defense. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 2nd, 2022

Defendant Helen J Bender in court.  Attorney Marcellus N Parker in court for Helen J Bender.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Victims present. Defense informs court case may be in DPA posture. State may re-evaluated the case status for reasons placed on the record. 
Court admonishes defendant regarding the established no contact order.
Case adjourned.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Helen J Bender in court with attorney Marcellus N Parker.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Court addressed State's Amended Criminal Complaint regarding correcting dates in the charging/probable cause section. Defense does not object. 
Court ordered Amended Criminal Complaint to be updated to reflect correct dates.
Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer and requests additional time to review.
Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Remaining cash bail to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DPH, SEM.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Helen J Bender in court with attorney Marcellus N Parker.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
